places_with_reviews.name: Saiva Kshetram Thallaya Palem Temple
places_with_reviews.address: GGRM+X66, Guntur, Amaravati, Andhra Pradesh 522503, India

reviews.text: This is the one of the best saiva kshetram name called koti linga temple there are so many types of sivalingas and Naga Pratima and Navagraha structure and there is the one main thing there are marakata godess statues there are best thing daily done Anna santharpana i strongly recommend in our life must visit this place

The TEMPLE WAS AWESOME AND VERY DIVITIONAL AND ON EVERY STEP WE HAD TEMPLE. Religious Significance: As a Shaiva Kshetram, it holds importance for devotees of Lord Shiva.
Pleasant surroundings: The temple is situated near the Krishna River, creating a serene atmosphere.
Free meal service: The temple offers free meals to visitors, promoting a sense of community and service.
Religious significance: Temples serve as a central place for worship, offering a space for devotees to connect with their faith and perform rituals.
Cultural heritage: Many temples are architectural marvels, showcasing historical and artistic elements. They act as repositories of cultural heritage and traditions.
Sense of community: Temples foster a sense of belonging and community among followers of the same faith. They often provide a platform for social gatherings and celebrations.
Peaceful haven: Temples can provide a sense of peace and tranquility due to their serene atmosphere and emphasis on spiritual reflection.

Very huge area . I.e 8 acres of land allotted for saiva temple by sri siva swamiji . I visisted long back around 2008 when it was just a small temple with all the siva lingas marakatha lingam, swarna, loha ,ratna, rasa, spatika etc lingas.  Now we got to see the structured temple  with 108 ganeshas, veebadhra swamy and maha kaali statues , and nakshatra vanam, and sahasra lingas and there exists a facility to "siva pratista" to which  your sivalinga pratista wil b allotted number and 108 ganeshas mandir is there. And panchaloha lingas, mercury abhishekam to sivalingas, and marakatha lingam... and the gold swarna lingam is having tomb like kedarnath and the garbharakshambika amma, natarajasamethaammavari darshan etc.

Urdhwa mukha and chathurmukha kotilingeswara swamy temple is completed and is open.

Probably, in coming few years, the temple will be completely constructed. For now it is under construction.

Visited today on 6th Jan 2024 and did our baby annaprasana....

It's a very big temple and lot of construction is still going on...

Felt very peaceful and devotional......
Temple with many god Siva need so much time to see around the temple

reviews.text:
Praise the serene atmosphere, spiritual ambiance, and architectural beauty of the lord venkateswara temple. Emphasize the cultural richness, respectful staff, and the significance of rituals. Share your personal connection and the sense of peace experienced during your visit. Om namo venkatesaya.
Temple timings:- 6:00am to 7:45 pm (12:30 noon & 6:00 pm half an hour  break)

places_with_reviews.name: Avadhutha Polaiah Swami Temple
places_with_reviews.address: GH82+7RJ, Venkata Palem, Amaravati, Andhra Pradesh 522503, India

reviews.text: We have the opportunity to meet Sri Avadhuta Polaiah Swami 5 years ago. He blessed us and gave us prasad for our Gurudev Paramahamsa Vishwananda
Best devotonal place great sage saint

Today visited Avadhutha Polayya Swami gaaru with my office staff.

Felt great bliss in his presence.

Got dal rice as his prasad.
We took nothing for him as offering But one devotee gave us fruits to all of us as our prasad.

My dad believed him soo much!!! Though i am not a devotee personly...felt something at this place... Nd i was very much amused dat they provide lunch everyday for devotees!! Visited twice never got bored though we stayed there for whole day!!
Lord Sai Baba in Temple & Polaiah Swamy next to it in a small room. Swamy is not in a good health now a days & one can only see him from a 6 ft distance behind a rope due to covid restrictions.
